title: ’Ditwah’ leaves 2.2 million people affected across Sri Lanka
byline: The total number of people affected by Cyclone Ditwah has risen to 2.2 million, with 1.7 million people severely impacted, according to the latest figures released by the Disaster Management Centre.

title: Oil leak reported at Colombo Port during crude oil transfer
byline: A leak has been reported in a pipeline while a ship was unloading crude oil at the Colombo Port.

title: John Cena ends his wrestling career in defeat
byline: The iconic WWE wrestler lost the final match of his storied run, as Gunther emerged victorious at Saturday Night’s Main Event on Dec. 13.

title: AI technology for disaster resilience explored
byline: The Association of Disaster Risk Management Professionals (ADRMP) Sri Lanka successfully launched a national initiative titled “GeoAI for Disaster Resilience”, aimed at strengthening Sri Lanka’s capacity to predict, prepare for, and respond to disasters using cutting-edge geospatial and artificial intelligence technologies.

title: Police hunt for gunman who killed 2 Brown University students, injured 9 people
byline: Police in Rhode Island were searching for a suspect late on Saturday after a shooting at Brown University in Providence left two students dead and eight others critically wounded at the Ivy League school, officials said. A ninth person was hurt by bullet fragments, the mayor said.

title: SC to hear former Moscow Defence Attaché’s son’s FR on university admission
byline: The Supreme Court is scheduled to hear a Fundamental Rights petition filed by the son of the former Defence Attaché to Moscow, challenging the decision of the University Grants Commission not accept his application to local universities.

title: 2.3kg of heroin seized at BIA; suspect arrested
byline: A suspect has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with 2.3 kilograms of heroin, police said.

title: UAE relief teams conclude humanitarian mission in Sri Lanka
byline: UAE relief teams have concluded their humanitarian mission in Sri Lanka as part of the urgent response launched by the United Arab Emirates, under the directives of President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, to support those affected by Cyclone Ditwah and the landslides that struck the country.

title: Sri Lankan passenger arrested for smuggling whiskey at BIA
byline: A 28-year-old Sri Lankan businessman from Minuwangoda was arrested yesterady for attempting to bring a stock of foreign-made whiskey into the country illegally.

title: Foreign tourists flock to Sripada to witness sunrise
byline: With favorable weather conditions in the mornings, a large number of foreign tourists have been visiting the Sripada shrine to watch the sunrise.

title: Starlink donates 100 satellite units to boost Sri Lanka’s disaster response
byline: The Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development says US-based Starlink has donated 100 satellite internet units to assist disaster management activities in the country.

title: Education should not burden children after disasters: Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that education should not be a burden for children as the country recovers from recent disasters. She stressed that the mental and emotional well-being of students should be a top priority to create a safe and supportive school environment.

title: John Cena ends his wrestling career in defeat
byline: The iconic WWE wrestler lost the final match of his storied run, as Gunther emerged victorious at Saturday Night’s Main Event on Dec. 13.

title: India donates essential drugs, dry food to Sri Lanka
byline: The Indian government has donated a consignment of essential drugs and dry food items to Sri Lanka.

title: Rains to increase from December 16: Met. Dept.
byline: The Meteorology Department said that showery conditions are expected to enhance to some extent over the island from December 16, 2025.

title: TPA calls for urgent meeting with President
byline: Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) leader MP Mano Ganesan, in a letter addressed to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has sought a meeting with him to discuss disaster challenges facing the Malaiyaha (up-country) Sri Lankan community.

title: Bondi Beach shooting: At least 10 killed and several injured in park attack
byline: Police say at least 10 people have been killed in a shooting near a Jewish gathering at Sydney’s Bondi Beach.

title: Defence Ministry issues guidelines on disaster-affected empowerment program
byline: The Ministry of Defence has issued guidelines in connection with the circular on implementing the disaster-affected empowerment program.

title: UNFPA launches USD 8.3Mn appeal to support women affected by Ditwah
byline: The United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) has launched a USD 8.3 million humanitarian appeal to provide urgent assistance to women and girls affected by Cyclone Ditwah, which caused severe flooding and landslides across Sri Lanka.

title: Thailand declares curfew along coast as Cambodia border fighting spreads
byline: Thailand announced a curfew in its southeastern Trat province on Sunday as fighting with Cambodia spread to coastal areas of a disputed border region, two days after U.S. President and would-be peacemaker Donald Trump said the sides had agreed to stop.

title: Three dead in Bondi Beach shooting
byline: At least three people were killed and six injured as gunmen opened fire at a Hanukkah party on Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia on Sunday.

title: Kandy Deputy Mayor’s daughter among 27 arrested at Facebook-organised drug party
byline: Twenty-seven persons, including the 26-year-old daughter of Kandy Deputy Mayor Ruwan Kumara of the National People’s Power, who were arrested with narcotics following a police raid on a party organised through social media in Teldeniya, were released on bail.

title: Jerome Fernando Charity Foundation launches islandwide flood relief initiative
byline: The Prophet Jerome Fernando Charity Foundation has launched a major island-wide flood relief initiative to support affected families and individuals.

title: Ditwah destroys over 6,000 houses
byline: The total number of houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka due to the calamity triggered by Cyclone Ditwah has exceeded 6,000, according to the latest report issued by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).
